citations.desc: Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors).
citations.narrative:
The licensee has one bottle Gentamicin Sulfate that expired 12-23 and a bottle of "Eye drops" labeled with 12-23. Per the
licensee, the bottle of eye drops contains a Gentamicin mixture done in house per veterinary instruction. All medications
must be properly labeled as to what is in the containers and a clear expiration date of the product.
Expired medications and medications improperly labeled do not ensure that the medications are effective at treating or
preventing diseases or illness and the health of the animal may suffer. Each dealer shall use appropriate methods to
prevent, control, diagnose, and treat diseases and injuries. The licensee must ensure all medications not expired and are
labeled appropriately.

citations.desc: Cleaning, sanitization, housekeeping, and pest control.
citations.narrative:
The licensee does not sanitize the food receptacles every 2 weeks. The licensee states sanitizing of food receptacles is
done once a month. Failure to sanitize enclosures may increase the risk of disease hazards towards the dogs.
Used primary enclosures and food and water receptacles for dogs must be sanitized at least once every 2 weeks and
more often if necessary to prevent an accumulation of dirt, debris, food waste, excreta, and other disease hazards. Hard
surfaces must be sanitized using one of the following methods: live steam under pressure or washing with hot water (at
least 180° F) and soap or detergent. The licensee must clean and sanitize the primary enclosures and ensure that all
aspects of the enclosure are maintained in a clean and sanitized condition in order to support the health of the dogs.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with licensee.
n

narrative:
2.40(b)(2)  Repeat
   
Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors). 
The licensee has one bottle Gentamicin Sulfate that expired 12-23 and a bottle of "Eye drops" labeled with 12-23. Per the 
licensee, the bottle of eye drops contains a Gentamicin mixture done in house per veterinary instruction. All medications 
must be properly labeled as to what is in the containers and a clear expiration date of the product. 
Expired medications and medications improperly labeled do not ensure that the medications are effective at treating or 
preventing diseases or illness and the health of the animal may suffer. Each dealer shall use appropriate methods to 
prevent, control, diagnose, and treat diseases and injuries. The licensee must ensure all medications not expired and are 
labeled appropriately. 
3.11(b)(2)  Repeat
   
Cleaning, sanitization, housekeeping, and pest control. 
The licensee does not sanitize the food receptacles every 2 weeks. The licensee states sanitizing of food receptacles is 
done once a month. Failure to sanitize enclosures may increase the risk of disease hazards towards the dogs. 
Used primary enclosures and food and water receptacles for dogs must be sanitized at least once every 2 weeks and 
more often if necessary to prevent an accumulation of dirt, debris, food waste, excreta, and other disease hazards. Hard 
surfaces must be sanitized using one of the following methods: live steam under pressure or washing with hot water (at 
least 180° F) and soap or detergent. The licensee must clean and sanitize the primary enclosures and ensure that all 
aspects of the enclosure are maintained in a clean and sanitized condition in order to support the health of the dogs. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with licensee.
